title: Waiting time for Hong Kong public rental flat rises slightly to 5.4 years
summary: The average waiting time for a Hong Kong public rental flat increased slightly to 5.4 years in the second quarter of 2025 from 5.3 years in the first three months of the year despite a significant drop in the number of applications, according to the Housing Authority.
fullContent: The average waiting time for a Hong Kong public rental flat increased slightly to 5.4 years in the second quarter of 2025 from 5.3 years in the first three months of the year despite a significant drop in the number of applications, according to the Housing Authority. The authority, the city’s largest public housing provider, on Thursday pointed to applicants being allocated refurbished public housing recovered from tenants or evicted due to abuse of resources in urban areas. title: Klarna’s Quarterly Net Loss Widens After 64% Surge in Provisions

fullContent: Klarna Group Plc had to set aside more money for potentially souring loans in the second quarter, a move that put pressure on profits ahead of its expected public debut.

title: The Age of AI Soft Power
summary: The conventional wisdom about America and China competing in a winner-takes-all race for AI supremacy is incomplete and increasingly outdated. The most influential AI tools of the future will be the ones that win over the most users, and nowadays they could originate from...
fullContent: The conventional wisdom about America and China competing in a winner-takes-all race for AI supremacy is incomplete and increasingly outdated. The most influential AI tools of the future will be the ones that win over the most users, and nowadays they could originate from almost anywhere.
